alert.note: Alert for Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 2:50AM EST until February 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Barbourville affecting Knox County. Pork Fork Cumberland River at Cumberland affecting Harlan County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Barbourville. * WHEN...From early this morning to Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Low lying roads flood. Manchester street floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.7 feet on Saturday and then begin to recede. - Action stage is 21.5 feet. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The next statement will be issued by 3 PM EST.
